column4: Hey everyone. I have a problem. If I'm playing music, emesene doesn't make any sounds. How do I fix this?
your problem has most likely something to do with pulseaudio. Take a look at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PulseAudio
thanks. i know im using alsa though. so its weird that it has something to do with pulseaudio. but ill check it out
its just a problem with emesene though.. firefox and banshee for example can play at the same time and vlc even
ok. My problem was with Rhytmbox. When it was playing I had no sound for other applications.
oh yea, i had that problem too but i fixed it after awhile
Bucketface , im sure its related.. i just cant figure out how to configure sound in emesene
look in options, plugin in the emesene menus
yea i did.. pretty limited menu :P
no idea how it is since I don't use emesene. I just googled for your problem and they mentioned that menu.
well thanks anyway. if anyone knows the answer i hope to hear it :D
have you considered other MSN clients?
could try some others
what do you use?

I use pidgin but the main reason it's because aside msn I also use yahoo, aim and gtalk. With pidgin I get all in one. The new version will have support for offline chating and personal messages but not yet
yea i guess pidgin will do =)
aMSN is a dedicated MSN messenger which already has support for offline messaging and the like. Pidgin new version isn't in the repositories yet
when will it be?

I don't know if pidgin comes with all the plugins installed by default. If not, install guifications for toaster-like popups and plugin-pack for a lot of nice things like "psychic mode", "auto-reply" and "auto-replace"
probably when 8.10 comes out, which is to say in October. You can try to compile it yourself or give the debian repositories a shot
the other day i couldnt get wireless working. that was horrible. but i'll just try the different stuff. im not that picky actually
thanks for your time =)
you're welcome
